dtliExcerpt: The production is handsomely mounted and intelligently directed by David Leveaux, but it suffers from a central problem: Mr. Bloom, though he looks every inch the romantic leading man, lacks the vocal technique necessary to bring off Shakespeare's verse.
bwwExcerpt: Would that Mr. Bloom's big entrance led to something interesting, but this "R & J" is a slick, weightless assemblage of modern-dress trickery (Romeo wears a hoodie and jeans) whose conception is as stale as its been-there-seen-that d√©cor and TV-movie music.
